concepts.title: Five-Kingdom Classification
concepts.content: In 1969, Robert Whittaker divided living organisms into 5 kingdoms: Monera, Protista, Fungi, Plantae, and Animalia. This was based on cell structure (Prokaryotic/Eukaryotic), complexity of organism (Unicellular/Multicellular), and mode of nutrition (Autotrophic/Heterotrophic).

concepts.title: Classification of Microbes
concepts.content: Microbes are classified into Bacteria, Protozoa, Fungi, Algae, and Viruses. Bacteria are prokaryotic and multiply by binary fission. Viruses are the smallest and require a host cell to reproduce. Fungi and Algae can be eukaryotic.
